The best records available indicate that the origin of the McAllen Station
came in 1921, when four Immigration Officers were assigned to patrol the
river from about the halfway point between Hidalgo, Texas and Rio Grande
City, Texas, to about the halfway point between Hidalgo, Texas, and
Brownsville, Texas. The primary responsibility of the four officers was to
apprehend Asiatic or European aliens who might be attempting to enter
illegally, and to apprehend smugglers of contraband, primarily liquor.
From these humble beginnings, McAllen Station has grown in importance and
size. The McAllen Station is responsible for patrolling 53 miles the Rio
Grande. The mission of the McAllen Station is to protect and defend the
homeland from terrorists and weapons of mass effect and the goal of
operations is to gain operation control of our nation's borders. McAllen
Station operates out of newly constructed 68,000-square-foot state of the
art facility located at: 3000 W. Military Highway, McAllen, Texas.
